definition: to like/to be fond of
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
joyous/happy/pleased
variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
hubbub/clamor/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
happily
charming/attractive/delightful
to attract people's affection/charming/delightful

sentences.english: They love to run about on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢在海滩上跑来跑去。

sentences.english: Seahorses like to live in shallow waters amongst the seaweed and eelgrass.
sentences.chinese: 海马喜欢住在海藻或鳗草丛中的浅海。

sentences.english: Too many magazines like to feature sleek models on the cover.
sentences.chinese: 太多的杂志喜欢用时尚模特儿作封面。

sentences.english: You may vote who sever side you like.
sentences.chinese: 你可以投票选你喜欢的任一方。

sentences.english: With all the variety and adventure, Able Seaman Green said she enjoyed her work.
sentences.chinese: 面对变化和冒险，二等兵格林说她非常喜欢她的工作。

sentences.english: I prefer to use debit card when shop on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 我通常喜欢用提款卡在网上购物。

sentences.english: If you don't like the weather at front window, see the weather at back window. (
sentences.chinese: 如果你不喜欢前窗的天气，不妨看看后窗的。
老板喜欢认真工作的员工。

sentences.english: As a matter of fact, Edward was very fond of cooking and foodstuff.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，爱德华非常喜欢烹饪和食品。

sentences.english: PSF: You prefer doing your work on your own in your studio?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢自己一个人在录音棚里捣鼓吗？

sentences.english: I love to meet up with my friends, get out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢和朋友们聚在一起，离开城市的喧嚣。
大家都不喜欢看到红色。

sentences.english: I also love classical literature, and Cao Xueqin is one of my favorite authors.
sentences.chinese: 我还喜欢古典文学，曹雪芹是我最喜欢的作家之一。

sentences.english: I also love classical literature, and Cao Xueqin is one of my favorite authors.
sentences.chinese: 我还喜欢古典文学，曹雪芹是我最喜欢的作家之一。

to love ardently/to adore
to be keen on/to have a passion for

to fall in love with/to be in love with
(onom.) smack!
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
